commit_message:
Replace the usage of 'admin_manager' with 'os_admin'

In tempest, alias 'admin_manager' has been moved to 'os_admin'
'alt_manager' to 'os_alt' and 'manager' to 'os_primary' in
version Pike, and it will be removed in version Queens[1].

[1]I5f7164f7a7ec5d4380ca22885000caa0183a0bf7

Change-Id: I162d5e4a7a9aa65d7abefbe74c1571e3106edcaf
Closes-bug: 1697588
(cherry picked from commit c7c497cc3a07dc69187efb8d3459c3a65c08c010)

commit_message:
Replace the usage of 'admin_manager' with 'os_admin'

In tempest, alias 'admin_manager' has been moved to 'os_admin'
'alt_manager' to 'os_alt' and 'manager' to 'os_primary' in
version Pike, and it will be removed in version Queens[1].

[1]I5f7164f7a7ec5d4380ca22885000caa0183a0bf7

Change-Id: I162d5e4a7a9aa65d7abefbe74c1571e3106edcaf

(cherry picked from commit c7c497cc3a07dc69187efb8d3459c3a65c08c010)

Most services now support being deploying in apache with mod_wsgi in
some form or another. In trying to standardize how we deploy SSL and
non-SSL sites in apache it is easier to simply always install apache and

commit_message:
Always install apache and mod_wsgi

Most services now support being deploying in apache with mod_wsgi in
some form or another. In trying to standardize how we deploy SSL and
non-SSL sites in apache it is easier to simply always install apache and
mod_wsgi initially. In the unlikely event nothing is configured to use
them they are not a problem to have on the system.

Change-Id: I521cd7080d9f0d7ac74ad550780e6506a88124ed

commit_message:
Remove get_ip_version from ip_lib

As get_ip_version in neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib was
tagged for removal in 'Queens', it is recommended
that neutron.common.utils.get_ip_version will be
used instead. There is no usage of get_ip_version
via neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib in other projects [1].
It's safe to remove it now.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=get_ip_version&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I0ed13ee5daac46f68e45bf151dfd3913d70e7d28

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/77/505977/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2017 Catalyst IT Ltd All Rights Reserved. not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Interact with other OpenStack services ====================================== It's very easy to interact with other OpenStack services in your function. Let's take Python programming language and integration with Swift service for an example. At the time you create a function, you specify an entry, which is a function in your code module that Qinling can invoke when the service executes your code. Use the following general syntax structure when creating a function in Python which will interact with Swift service in OpenStack. .. code-block:: python import swiftclient def main(region_name, container, object, context=None, **kwargs): conn = swiftclient.Connection( session=context['os_session'], os_options={'region_name': region_name}, ) obj_info = conn.head_object(container, object) return obj_info In the above code, note the following: - Qinling supports most of OpenStack service clients, so you don't need to install ``python-swiftclient`` in your code package. - There is a parameter named ``context``, this is a parameter provided by Qinling that is usually of the Python dict type. You can easily get a valid Keystone session object from it. As a result, you don't need to pass any sensitive data to Qinling in order to interact with OpenStack services. .. note:: Please avoid using ``context`` as your own parameter in the code.

commit_message:
Refactored zaqar tempest plugin directory structure

* switch from zaqar.tests.tempest_plugin to zaqar_tempest_plugin
* Cleaned up README.rst and setup.cfg
* Use zaqar_tempest_plugin as a tempest plugin package
* Fixed git-review
* Fixed tox.ini

Implements: blueprint zaqar-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I78d657bcdec4d5c095af8eb1dfb93b5e3dfa0ff5

commit_message:
organize options based on backend drivers

Take advantage of oslo.config's new ability to specify that one option
in a group controls which of the rest apply and that another option may
have a list of dynamically controlled groups. This provides enough data
to the config sample generator that when it emits machine-readable
settings about the options in Cinder, a deployment tool can produce a
valid GUI (hiding options that do not apply based on the selected
driver) and a validation tool can review a configuration file (including
the sections with user-defined names).

Change-Id: I68a3fc5bc305ad5ffaeafb37a43743c2fad92498
Depends-On: I66b195835a7db3e32b16ddac2166782ff8592806
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add default configuration files to data_files

In order to make it simpler to use the default
configuration files when deploying services
from source, the files are added to pbr's
data_files section so that the files are
included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment
tools can then more easily use the default files
if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar
files for neutron and the glance metadefs as has
been mentioned in the related bug report.

Change-Id: Idbc616e9ca23b1b7187f39a1e157f56862851f6c
Closes-Bug: #1718356

commit_message:
Remove docker-network template from containers

Don't use docker-network template when deploying containers. This isn't
needed with the Pike containers, which use host network mode.

Change-Id: I0c5c1194e948b99352691df6e6e4ffaee858cddd

commit_message:
Use separate log collection playbook for TripleO CI

Log collection is very CI related and could be different for
various environments. In special TripleO CI case we need to exclude
127.0.0.2 host as it is the same as undercloud.

Change-Id: I157af1e04a522b6c5264a2261415ca3d992b1c91

commit_message:
Add support for manual promotion patches

When we check multinode jobs for promotion, it's still needed to
trigger it manually from patch. This patch adds support for
multinode_status script to check also multinode jobs from
specific patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/359215/
This string should be changed in script if different patch is used.

Change-Id: I89605164fff113a94c2f310c8f56f300d4e7ce57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/14/478514/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetimeimport time patches = { # Change this link if you change the patch for manual triggers 'http://logs.openstack.org/15/359215/': [ {'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-puppet': 'periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq'}, {'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-puppet': 'periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq'}, {'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-multinode-oooq-puppet': 'periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-multinode-oooq'}, {'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-multinode-oooq-puppet': 'periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-multinode-oooq'}, ] }class Manual(object): def __init__(self, link, jobs): self.base_link = link self.jobs_dict = jobs self.link_re = re.compile(r'<a href="(\d+)/">', re.MULTILINE) self.build_re = re.compile(r'<a href="(\w{7})/">', re.MULTILINE) self.time_re = re.compile(r'(\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d)') def extract_last_patch(self): web = Web(self.base_link) data = web.get() if data is None: return None text = data.content patches = self.link_re.findall(text) if patches: return sorted(patches, reverse=True)[0] else: return None def timing(self, link): html = Web(link + "/console.html.gz") data = html.get() if data is None: html = Web(link + "/console.html") data = html.get() if data is None: return 1 text = data.content if self.time_re.search(text[:30]): self.time_re.search(text[:30]).group(1) else: return 1 date = datetime.datetime.strptime( '2017-06-08 05:46:30', "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") timestamp = time.mktime(date.timetuple()) log.debug("Extracted timestamp: %s from %s", timestamp, link) return int(timestamp) def extract_builds(self, patch, name): builds_link = "/".join([self.base_link, patch, "check", name]) web = Web(builds_link) data = web.get() if data is None: return [] text = data.content builds = self.build_re.findall(text) sorted_builds = sorted( builds, key=lambda x: self.timing(builds_link + "/" + x), reverse=True) return sorted_builds def job_last_runs(self, job, number): job_name = job.keys()[0] run_link = "/".join( [self.base_link.strip("/"), "%s", "check", job_name, "%s"]) + "/" last_patch = self.extract_last_patch() if last_patch: builds = self.extract_builds(last_patch, job_name)[:number] runs = [run_link % (last_patch, build) for build in builds] return runs else: return [] def check_status(self, run): html = Web(run + "/console.html.gz") data = html.get() if data is None: html = Web(run + "/console.html") data = html.get() if data is None: return False text = data.content if "[Zuul] Job complete, result: SUCCES" in text: return True return False @property def passed_jobs(self): for job in self.jobs_dict: job_runs = self.job_last_runs(job, config.runs) passed_runs = (i for i in job_runs if self.check_status(i)) for run in passed_runs: dlrn = extract_dlrn(run) name = job.values()[0] log.debug("Manual patch %s: %s to %s", run, dlrn, name) if dlrn and name: yield {'dlrn': dlrn, 'name': name} return None log.debug("Adding success to metadata of %s", dlrn_hash) for link, patch in config.patches.items(): log.debug("Working on patch %s", link) p = Manual(link, patch) for passed_job in p.passed_jobs: if found(passed_job['dlrn']): log.debug("Adding success to metadata of %s", passed_job['dlrn']) add_job_to_metadata(passed_job['dlrn'], passed_job['name'])
deleted_lines: log.debug("Adding success to metdata of %s", dlrn_hash)

DO NOT REVIEW: TESTING ONLY * TESTING OVS 2.8.0-2

Testing to upgrade openvswitch to 2.8.0-2 and see how it
works before it can be promoted in RDO.

Change-Id: I113cbd43f9b80399d9ac755d6632936bc3b386ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/91/473191/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Add OVS 2.7 custom repo - TESTING ONLY yum_repository: name: OVS 2.7 test repo description: OVS 2.7 test repo baseurl: http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-common-candidate/x86_64/os gpgcheck: no includepkgs=openvswitch,openvswitch-ovn* - name: Update openvswitch - TEST tags: step2 shell: yum update -y openvswitch - name: Restart openvswitch - TEST service: name=openvswitch state=restarted
deleted_lines: - block: - name: "Ensure empty directory: emptying." file: state: absent path: /root/OVS_UPGRADE - name: "Ensure empty directory: creating." file: state: directory path: /root/OVS_UPGRADE owner: root group: root mode: 0750 - name: Download OVS packages. command: yumdownloader --destdir /root/OVS_UPGRADE --resolve openvswitch - name: Get rpm list for manual upgrade of OVS. shell: ls -1 /root/OVS_UPGRADE/*.rpm register: ovs_list_of_rpms - name: Manual upgrade of OVS shell: | rpm -U --test {{item}} 2>&1 | grep "already installed" || \ rpm -U --replacepkgs --notriggerun --nopostun {{item}}; args: chdir: /root/OVS_UPGRADE with_items: - "{{ovs_list_of_rpms.stdout_lines}}" when: "'2.5.0-14' in '{{ovs_version.stdout}}' or ovs_packaging_issue|succeeded"

commit_message:
FOR TESTING ONLY...TESTING ONLY

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/494293/ is giving a hard time
and timing out for the job gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq.
This job deploys OVN. The tempest scenario test is successful, but the cleanup of
the test is blocking in the API - "GET v2.0/security-groups?tenant_id=...".
This patch tries to debug this issue.

This patch will be used by this review - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500609/ which is
essentially the same as the above one.

Change-Id: I30ac7e6a5fd66a5184120834be3e3deb174f2f28

commit_message:
Give zuul user permissions to /opt/wheel/workspace

Otherwise, we cannot write anything to the folder.  Also clean up
shell task since our bash script already setups /bin/bash -ex.

Change-Id: I0a9770dfb1bf252cf092e6edc8491e6d801ab0e3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/43/506943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: group: zuul owner: zuul shell: ./scripts/wheel-build.sh {{ wheel_dir }} {{ wheel_python }} args: executable: /bin/bash

commit_message:
Install multipath binary in nova-compute image

multipath binary is required after enabled multipath in nova.

This patch is pushed to ocata branch first by mistake. Need cherry pick
into master and pike branch.

Change-Id: I0a1d85597999415cab11feb71a7fdfd7af3f7148
Closes-Bug: #1713639
(cherry picked from commit 4e6add7dbd80ef9326cc8a7e2afd5f6d02f1f68f)

It seems that 1) new " "translators were joined and the statistics was calculated but the file was " "already created, or 2) there might be some lack of communication with " "language coordinators, since I18n encouraged each language coordinator to " "update this file." msgstr "" "Ek ATC'ler teklif edilirken bazı çevirmenler `translation_team.yaml <http://" "git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/i18n/tree/tools/zanata/translation_team." "yaml?id=73a36041dbdc45212051c60cbeef3f7783200fd2>`__ dosyasına dahil " "edilmemişti. 1) yeni çevirmenler katılmıştı ve istatistikler hesaplanmıştı " "ama dosya zaten oluşturulmuş durumdaydı, veya 2) dil düzenleyiciler arasında " "bir iletişim sorunu oluşmuştu, çünkü I18n her bir dil düzenleyiciyi bu " "dosyayı güncellemeye teşvik ediyordu." msgid ""msgid "Zbyněk Schwarz (id: tsbook) - Czech" msgstr "Zbyněk Schwarz (id: tsbook) - Çek" "[ianychoi] Although one year was already passed (as of now: Jan 15, 2017), I " "really would like to say those translators also contributed translations " "with I18n team members. commit_message:
Update wheel-build.sh for zuulv3.o.o

We no longer have remotes on git repos pushed to our nodes. So just
check the local branches zuul knows about.

Change-Id: Ic70c84990a748df46a70426e7879941fb1deec0f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use devstack gate to run tempest tests

In before, we run tempest tests manually at post_test_hook.sh, which
is suboptimal and hard to maintain. This incurs challenges on splitting
tempest tests as well.

Most projects use devstack gate to run tempest tests. It is done by
setting DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX to point to the right set of
tests. Let's switch to this approach.

Change-Id: If29151755fb958d308ec3759b5d1a2a1200ccfc5

commit_message:
Add parallel to bindep.txt

The build-wheel-mirror job actually needs this to work, which is a
periodic job we run to build wheels for our AFS mirrors.

Change-Id: I2adcb0d89f9cf3fcc58a30b1d153e9528646f0ae
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove deprecated IpNeighCommand.show()

IpNeighCommand.show() was marked for deprecation in
Pike, remove it now that we're in Queens.

Change-Id: I120de98b15d4c516347f2ddb131a5e1c1e0c00c4

commit_message:
Cleanup unused get_iscsi_initiator.

This method simply isn't called anywhere.

Change-Id: I58270e7d340d4f96728bd9246d3128df817775ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/501944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Volume utilities for virt drivers. """ from os_brick.initiator import connector from oslo_concurrency import processutils as putils from nova import utils def get_iscsi_initiator(execute=None): """Get iscsi initiator name for this machine.""" root_helper = utils.get_root_helper() # so we can mock out the execute itself # in unit tests. if not execute: execute = putils.execute iscsi = connector.ISCSIConnector(root_helper=root_helper, execute=execute) return iscsi.get_initiator()

This verifies whether the opensuse failures seen in devstack gate are caused by the LVM_TYPE change.

This reverts commit 486376e91b1f9a7680371036e470b8692804e917.

'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Revert "Change CINDER_LVM_TYPE to 'auto' as the default"

This verifies whether the opensuse failures seen in devstack gate are caused by the LVM_TYPE change.

This reverts commit 486376e91b1f9a7680371036e470b8692804e917.

Change-Id: I306546fed8670e0efa34357a71daa05f85e8106e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/49/506849/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to default, which is thick, the other valid choice # is thin, which as the name implies utilizes lvm thin provisioning. # Thinly provisioned LVM volumes may be more efficient when using the Cinder # image cache, but there are also known race failures with volume snapshots # and thinly provisioned LVM volumes, see bug 1642111 for details. CINDER_LVM_TYPE=${CINDER_LVM_TYPE:-default}
deleted_lines: # Defaults to auto, which will do thin provisioning if it's a fresh # volume group, otherwise it will do thick. The other valid choices are # default, which is thick, or thin, which as the name implies utilizes lvm # thin provisioning. CINDER_LVM_TYPE=${CINDER_LVM_TYPE:-auto}

commit_message:
Prioritise evaluator events on notification events

Making sure that when we receive an notifications events we
first work on the evaluator events if there are such, and only then
on the notification events

Change-Id: I18698469b67f8265e53ece1b52459c0fde3fb7e4

writing convention: do not use “-y” for package install

refer to:
https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/ \
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I59b33fbe5761beb344b6be83ab81451a5a4d51a9

commit_message:
Improve context manager setup()/cleanup() logging

Instead of requiring to put over and over decorator on cleanup()
and setup() methods let's do it once in context manager

Change-Id: I17b8e89bf35a434749ff6094d7790df8f86fd1bb

commit_message:
Fix to use "." to source script files

Adhering to coding conventions. Refer to ``Code conventions`` at

commit_message:
Dont log about skipping notification in normal case

Avoid logging about a missing resource for normal cases
where there is no resource in the request (e.g. HTTP GET's,
custom actions, etc).

Change-Id: I04c6b6737f238ca6250869b92e1d0771b4f95f22
Partial-Bug: #1707307

bindep.

subject: Treat lack of segment info in port object as unbound
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-15 20:44:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/42f90203dde38830882518709e471f105451ff3a', 'message': 'Treat lack of segment info in port object as unbound

A push notifications change added segment information
to the get_device_details() RPC call, but sometimes the
segment information is not present, resulting in an
AttributeError.  Just treat the lack of segment info
as if the port was unbound, since the port is probably
in the process of being removed.

Change-Id: I631c6e1f02fa07eed330c99a96aa66d747784f37
Closes-bug: #1714068
(cherry picked from commit 4833852abb864230daecf97bc672ad9a4a9c4267)
'}]
commit_message:
Treat lack of segment info in port object as unbound

A push notifications change added segment information
to the get_device_details() RPC call, but sometimes the
segment information is not present, resulting in an
AttributeError.  Just treat the lack of segment info
as if the port was unbound, since the port is probably
in the process of being removed.

Change-Id: I631c6e1f02fa07eed330c99a96aa66d747784f37
Closes-bug: #1714068
(cherry picked from commit 4833852abb864230daecf97bc672ad9a4a9c4267)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/504515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not segment: LOG.debug("Device %s is not bound to any segment.", port_obj) return {'device': device}

commit_message:
rally: switch to new format for context name

Since I9d3bafa075631a3f48cbd3627a4cc1a5a859cce2 in rally, platform
should be part of context name (context@platform).

Otherwise, a warning message (or even breakage because of
I10ac687f9f420dcf0d907b51d5d9303f68d35719) may be triggered.

Change-Id: I6f84282d22d13d36dcba221ab9d94c3fda95f130
(cherry picked from commit 8f49038829f1854add9f3f103868f2d619140919)

commit_message:
LVM: Activate thin snapshot before clone activation

LVM may be configured to not automatically activate
thin-provisioned LVs. Ensure they are activated before
activating a clone, otherwise activating the clone may fail.

Change-Id: Iaedeb3cdc706daa34db8d50c48cf738f6edb9bcf
Related-Bug: #1642111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/01/505601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Some configurations of LVM do not automatically activate # ThinLVM snapshot LVs. self.vg.activate_lv(snapshot['name'], is_snapshot=True)

commit_message:
Skip centos-7 wheel builder for now

Focus on getting ubuntu working first, once working we can then switch
to centos-7. This way we can focus on 1 distro at a time.

Change-Id: I5c6b48f127a7fbc5221a88bba06e461d4846a56c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Check that generate-subunit exists before using it

If stack.sh fails before os-testr is installed, the generate-subunit
command won't exist.

Change-Id: I7998ed81e419e25d183e5a780df0b4459cca237c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/51/502351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If we error before we've installed os-testr, which will fail. if type -p generate-subunit > /dev/null; then generate-subunit $DEVSTACK_START_TIME $SECONDS 'fail' >> ${SUBUNIT_OUTPUT} fi # If we error before we've installed os-testr, which will fail. if type -p generate-subunit > /dev/null; then generate-subunit $DEVSTACK_START_TIME $SECONDS >> ${SUBUNIT_OUTPUT} fi

commit_message:
Document steps to enable and customize tempest notifications

Since we are now executing tempest in our gates, it is good to have
the steps required to enable and customize notifications documented

Change-Id: Ie5703eb43a9a7676aba711482797e8725d0f9878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/35/502535/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Enabling tempest tests ---------------------- In order to run tempest on your job, you need to set the variables run_tempest and tempest_config to true in your deployment, either with -e option, or in your featureset file. You can see an example in `this featureset <https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/config/general_config/featureset005.yml>`_. Customizing tempest tests ------------------------- There are two ways to customize which tests you want to run, the first one, is setting a regular expression for the test_regex (default is 'smoke'). or have a list of specific tests set in tempest_whitelist, for example:: tempest_whitelist: - 'tempest.scenario.test_volume_boot_pattern.TestVolumeBootPattern.test_volume_boot_pattern' - 'ceilometer.tests.tempest.scenario.test_telemetry_integration.TestTelemetryIntegration' **Note** you must set test_regex to '' to use tempest_whitelist, otherwise the validate-tempest role will also parse the --regex option, and your test will only be executed if it matches the regex.

commit_message:
Change CINDER_LVM_TYPE to 'auto' as the default

This was previously set to thin as the default, but at the time
there were failures seen with what appeared to be race conditions
when creating snapshots.

These failures are not seen locally, and we have a lot of installs
using the default auto by this point with no reports from the field
of seeing this failure. This is to be able to more extensively test
this in the gate, and hopefully get this switched over to be able
to thinly provision by default when possible.

Change-Id: I3e99adadd1c37ba8b24b6cb71a8969ffc93f75a1
Related-bug: #1642111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/49/501049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to auto, which will do thin provisioning if it's a fresh # volume group, otherwise it will do this. The other valid choices are # default, which is thick, or thin, which as the name implies utilizes lvm # thin provisioning. CINDER_LVM_TYPE=${CINDER_LVM_TYPE:-auto}
deleted_lines: # Defaults to default, which is thick, the other valid choice # is thin, which as the name implies utilizes lvm thin provisioning. # Thinly provisioned LVM volumes may be more efficient when using the Cinder # image cache, but there are also known race failures with volume snapshots # and thinly provisioned LVM volumes, see bug 1642111 for details. CINDER_LVM_TYPE=${CINDER_LVM_TYPE:-default}

commit_message:
Remove the method get_iscsi_initiator in volumeutils.py

The method get_iscsi_initiator is useless and never be called anywhere.
So this mehtod can be removed.

Change-Id: Ifd8db9cc8823e7beac4b84b43857e61ba31f7a37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/506846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Volume utilities for virt drivers. """ from os_brick.initiator import connector from oslo_concurrency import processutils as putils from nova import utils def get_iscsi_initiator(execute=None): """Get iscsi initiator name for this machine.""" root_helper = utils.get_root_helper() # so we can mock out the execute itself # in unit tests. if not execute: execute = putils.execute iscsi = connector.ISCSIConnector(root_helper=root_helper, execute=execute) return iscsi.get_initiator()

commit_message:
Use constants for microversion values

We very often end up with merge conflicts for any patches that increment
microversions due to conflicting numbers. We can't really solve that,
but we can avoid the need to update version numbers throughout the code
by defining a constant value in one place and using that variable instead.

Change-Id: Ib3a80fee6caaabb49af097aa197f550c65d94985

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-22 10:28:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6f33f3ea5dd266c9b4edb0ddc2d7891066160605', 'message': 'Fix 500 if list servers called with empty regex pattern

provided filter regex is empty string. If user is intending to filter
something, user must pass something to the filter, it cannot be a empty
string.

commit_message:
Fix 500 if list servers called with empty regex pattern

If nova list API is called with empty regex pattern like below:
    http://<host-ip>/compute/v2.1/servers?name=""

it fails at db layer and returns 500 InternalServerError.

Empty string('') is a valid regex for re.compile [1] so nova-api fails
to catch it at schema layer and it is passed to databse for searching.
Database fails to search it with "REGEXP %(display_name_1)s)" and
'display_name_1' as u'' in sql query which leads to below error:

InternalError: (1139, u"Got error 'empty (sub)expression' from regexp")

This issue is there for every query parameter which is using below
regex parameter types defined in parameter_types.py:
    common_query_regex_param

This patch fixes this issue by rejecting the request with 400 if the
provided filter regex is empty string. If user is intending to filter
something, user must pass something to the filter, it cannot be a empty
string.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/16.0.0/nova/api/validation/validators.py#L40

Closes-Bug: #1718877
Change-Id: I3f6fa04dc7267279964e8e5dd2a790b997a40e4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/506585/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable resource summary

In order to be able to identify slow execution times, we can enable
resoure summary in order to be able to know how long specific things
take to evaluate.

Change-Id: I1ed0251dcd57b6817f4bd5dd2e7ae4dec4f18706

commit_message:
Raise oslo.db minimum from 4.24.0 to 4.27.0

oslo.db will NOT throw the deprecated DbMigrationError since 4.27.0
Consumers should use DBMigrationError instead.

commit_message:
Add pep8 check that generated environments are up to date

This check ensures that if a parameter is changed that would affect
a generated environment then the environment must be updated before
pep8 will pass.  It will also catch any mistaken hand edits to the
generated files.

bp generated-environments

Change-Id: I2d12992ed55f963285422e1282a4cee06e989b6d

commit_message:
Add "nat-addresses" option for support of garp feature.

This is used to send gratuitous ARPs for SNAT and DNAT IP addresses on gateway port via the localnet port.

Change-Id: Ic913866d83e43258867d728d06410e0a08e59afb

commit_message:
Add capsule method in zunclient

1. Add new entry point /experimental alongside v1.
2. Capsule will use this entrypoint for quickly
development.

Part of blueprint introduce-compose

Change-Id: I592608aff001c53c76ee23681566156fa1aa71ed
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient refs/changes/55/480455/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 ARM Holdings. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from zunclient.common import cliutils as utils from zunclient.common import template_utils from zunclient.common import utils as zun_utils from zunclient.i18n import _ def _show_capsule(capsule): utils.print_dict(capsule._info) @utils.arg('-f', '--template-file', metavar='<file>', help=_('Path to the template.')) def do_capsule_create(cs, args): """Create a capsule.""" opts = {} if args.template_file: tpl_files, template = template_utils.get_template_contents( args.template_file) opts['spec'] = template cs.capsules.create(**opts) @utils.arg('--all-tenants', action="store_true", default=False, help='List containers in all tenants') @utils.arg('--marker', metavar='<marker>', default=None, help='The last container UUID of the previous page; ' 'displays list of containers after "marker".') @utils.arg('--limit', metavar='<limit>', type=int, help='Maximum number of containers to return') @utils.arg('--sort-key', metavar='<sort-key>', help='Column to sort results by') @utils.arg('--sort-dir', metavar='<sort-dir>', choices=['desc', 'asc'], help='Direction to sort. "asc" or "desc".') def do_capsule_list(cs, args): """Print a list of available containers.""" opts = {} opts['all_tenants'] = args.all_tenants opts['marker'] = args.marker opts['limit'] = args.limit opts['sort_key'] = args.sort_key opts['sort_dir'] = args.sort_dir opts = zun_utils.remove_null_parms(**opts) capsules = cs.capsules.list(**opts) zun_utils.list_capsules(capsules) @utils.arg('capsules', metavar='<capsule>', nargs='+', help='ID or name of the (capsule)s to delete.') @utils.arg('-f', '--force', action='store_true', help='Force delete the capsule.') def do_capsule_delete(cs, args): """Delete specified capsules.""" for capsule in args.capsule: try: cs.capsule.delete(capsule, args.force) print("Request to delete capsule %s has been accepted." % capsule) except Exception as e: print("Delete for capsule %(capsule)s failed: %(e)s" % {'capsule': capsule, 'e': e})

commit_message:
make net_helpers functions work on OpenSUSE

/sbin may not be in the regular user's PATH or tools like sysctl/ss
may require root privileges to execute correctly on OpenSUSE, and this
makes net_helpers functions fail with OSError. There is no harm in
running ss or sysctl as root user for these functions and that allows
fullstack/functional tests to operate correctly on OpenSUSE.

The change requires a testcase to inherit from BaseSudoTestCase due
to the new run_as_root=True flag.

Change-Id: Ia4f2af1d44faacf5f7ab5471b4f18ecb27f06549

commit_message:
add parameter to overwrite/add wsgi process options

Add parameter to apache_wsgi to allow overwrite
and/or add additional wsgi process options.

This possibility was added to openstacklib
with Change-Id: I41914ce3361988d5db1695f09d21209772fdf548

Change-Id: I93e1d46e1f7c3121f866251620bf88435d4084d1
(cherry picked from commit 5e0be79f84df944b1ae73f334e98a84f51117054)

commit_message:
add parameter to overwrite/add wsgi process options

Add parameter to apache_wsgi to allow overwrite
and/or add additional wsgi process options.

This possibility was added to openstacklib
with Change-Id: I41914ce3361988d5db1695f09d21209772fdf548

Change-Id: I1a2f1a28200d362b7918a458e8f885873062e98b
(cherry picked from commit 560b82e9ae36d52f8eaca2e07d5d6ba58c61a3dc)

added_lines: --- features: - Add parameter to apacher_wsgi to allow overwrite and/or add additional wsgi process options.

commit_message:
Deprecate project_id and user_id options

Option "user_id" from group "statsd" is deprecated for removal.
Its value may be silently ignored in the future.
Option "project_id" from group "statsd" is deprecated for removal.
Its value may be silently ignored in the future

Change-Id: Ib2122af574075c4a83609116251478b3c37519a1
Closes-Bug: #1718848

commit_message:
Deprecate revocation_cache_time option

The revocation_cache_time is deprecated for removel because of PKI
token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: Ib42570c94cf9b2778ae8ffcfb22ca7e129176330
Closes-Bug: #1717144
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/20/503920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - revocation_cache_time option is now deprecated for removal, the parameter has no effect.

configuration files when deploying services
from source, the files are added to pbr's
data_files section so that the files are
included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment
tools can then more easily use the default files
if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar

commit_message:
Add default configuration files to data_files

In order to make it simpler to use the default
configuration files when deploying services
from source, the files are added to pbr's
data_files section so that the files are
included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment
tools can then more easily use the default files
if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar
files for neutron, designate and glance as has
been mentioned in the related bug report.

Change-Id: I1f3c9b2e27d44f28f0e649e2c96a1c3dc1da9ea6
Closes-Bug: #1718356
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/06/506206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data_files = etc/heat = etc/heat/api-paste.ini etc/heat/policy.json etc/heat/environment.d = etc/heat/environment.d/* etc/heat/templates = etc/heat/templates/*

commit_message:
Add Documentation for using a SoftHSM for testing

This patch adds documentation for using a SoftHSM. It is useful
because it allows a developer without access to an HSM to be able
to peform PKCS-11 Tests with Barbican.

Change-Id: I2cd814f8270de85def56336bd4fa0c4b109143af

commit_message:
Add api documentation for transport keys

This patch adds api documentation for transport keys. It also
provides documentation on how to add a transport key to a
Secret.

Change-Id: I5d950254d76509280b0e20f42297ffe727825b74
Closes-Bug: #1459783

commit_message:
[3/3] Implement policies in code

Leverage oslo.policy to register default policies in the
code. Administrator only need to update the specified
policy in the config file.

Supported APIs list:

1. volumes APIs
2. volume actions APIs
3. volume metadata APIs
4. volume image APIs
5. services APIs
6. volume type extra specs APIs
7. volume transfer APIs
8. All other rest APIs except cg and cg snapshot APIs

Change-Id: I4ee6d4755258245b2fdac3ab0f4ce8b07ef56603
Partial-Implements: blueprint policy-in-code
Depends-On: e82df51462dc8f8fb5072905f11d7c6fa58e2e73

commit_message:
[2/3] Implement policies in code

Leverage oslo.policy to register default policies in the
code. Administrator only need to update the specified
policy in the config file.

Supported APIs list:

1. groups APIs
2. group actions APIs
3. group snapshots APIs
4. group snapshot actions APIs
5. group types APIs
6. group type specs APIs
7. qos specs APIs
8. quota APIs
9. quota class APIs
10. cluster APIs
11. worker APIs

Change-Id: I748ee86c895987d03f9a2bdbee5c63f8ec23a880
Partial-Implements: blueprint policy-in-code
Depends-On: 4c0c73d47c83efe46137a6dffb41bc1d208c7bc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/90/483790/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import functools from cinder.objects import base as objects_baseimport cinder.policydef wrap_check_policy(func): """Check policy corresponding to the wrapped methods prior to execution. This decorator requires the first 3 args of the wrapped function to be (self, context, group) """ @functools.wraps(func) def wrapped(self, context, target_obj, *args, **kwargs): check_policy(context, func.__name__, target_obj) return func(self, context, target_obj, *args, **kwargs) return wrapped def check_policy(context, action, target_obj=None): target = { 'project_id': context.project_id, 'user_id': context.user_id, } if isinstance(target_obj, objects_base.CinderObject): # Turn object into dict so target.update can work target.update( target_obj.obj_to_primitive()['versioned_object.data'] or {}) else: target.update(target_obj or {}) _action = 'group:%s' % action cinder.policy.enforce(context, _action, target) check_policy(context, 'create') check_policy(context, 'create') @wrap_check_policy @wrap_check_policy check_policy(context, 'get', group) check_policy(context, 'get_all') @wrap_check_policy @wrap_check_policy check_policy(context, 'delete_group_snapshot') check_policy(context, 'update_group_snapshot') check_policy(context, 'get_group_snapshot') check_policy(context, 'get_all_group_snapshots') check_policy(context, 'reset_group_snapshot_status') @wrap_check_policy @wrap_check_policy @wrap_check_policy @wrap_check_policy

commit_message:
[1/3] Implement policies in code

Leverage oslo.policy to register default policies in the
code. Administrator only need to update the specified
policy in the config file.

Supported APIs list:

1. snapshot APIs.
2. snapshot metadata APIs
3. managable snapshot APIs
4. snapshot action APIs
5. backup APIs
6. backup action APIs
7. attachment APIs
8. message APIs

Partial-Implements: blueprint policy-and-docs-in-code

Change-Id: Iedde7a9a774a60e760b47d5eb2973f42d79227d8

subject: Change Nova Conductor workers to ::os_workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-22 22:08:52.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/conductor.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/cap_workers-586a6d2168ddabca.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/9fe9b56aebe01f2e043363c8df8394713602005b', 'message': 'Change Nova Conductor workers to ::os_workers

In Ieb69b5a6a50d37b0a49a8c9e57275673d60b5f10, the default
number of workers for the metadata_workers and osapi_compute_workers
was changed from $::processorcount to $::os_workers, which takes
CPU count into account but caps the number of workers for
machines with high numbers of CPUs.   The
"workers" configuration option used by Nova Conductor however
was left out of this, likely because it did not previously
default to $::processorcount.  However Nova itself defaults
all of these services to the processor count in any case,
and the number of workers for Conductor is likely the most critical
value to be limited, since it directly corresponds to pooled
database connections which when there are too many processes
results in often thousands of connections that are almost all
unused.   This patch limits Conductor workers in the same
way as that of the other worker counts.

Change-Id: I1969b555c1c8cfb686a12cad7f54ac10b1656af5
'}]
commit_message:
Change Nova Conductor workers to ::os_workers

In Ieb69b5a6a50d37b0a49a8c9e57275673d60b5f10, the default
number of workers for the metadata_workers and osapi_compute_workers
was changed from $::processorcount to $::os_workers, which takes
CPU count into account but caps the number of workers for
machines with high numbers of CPUs.   The
"workers" configuration option used by Nova Conductor however
was left out of this, likely because it did not previously
default to $::processorcount.  However Nova itself defaults
all of these services to the processor count in any case,
and the number of workers for Conductor is likely the most critical
value to be limited, since it directly corresponds to pooled
database connections which when there are too many processes
results in often thousands of connections that are almost all
unused.   This patch limits Conductor workers in the same
way as that of the other worker counts.

Change-Id: I1969b555c1c8cfb686a12cad7f54ac10b1656af5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/97/506797/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - Added Nova Conductor service to the list of services where the default number of spawned child processes for distributing processing have had their default value changed from ::processorcount to ::os_workers.

commit_message:
Adds the ability to specify ML2 ODL Features

This is required in order to override the negotiated default features
with OpenDaylight.  More specifically this is required so that we can
override the features list not to include operational-port-status to
fix the following bug.

Partial-Bug: 1718508

Change-Id: I7eb752ad692e5522051f8393376890fcac9a09fe
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2417be6fae4df4003be0471a405d09a653d29f5d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/83/506783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*odl_features*] # (optional) List of ODL features to enable # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $odl_features = $::os_service_default, 'ml2_odl/odl_features': value => join(any2array($odl_features), ',');

commit_message:
Configure bridge_mappings for ovs and linuxbridge agents

Otherwise neutron will fail to bind external ports because of missing
entries for external physical network in the mapping.

Configure it only when l3 agent is also installed on the node (otherwise
the l2 agent is not exposed to external network and hence doesn't have
the bridge).

Change-Id: I561b74538acb0dc39f1af3e832108ce6a99441b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/29/439829/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

when creating new volume.

commit_message:
Add quota.type field when reporting share usage

Adding field "type" will allow correct formatting of reported
values in "Overview" panel in Horizon. It will also make the fields
consistent with what's available in standard Horizon quotas.

Modify the '.gitignore' file

Since the horizon remove the 'run_tests.sh' file,
so there should remove '.venv' from the '.gitignore' file.
See the patch 'https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399842/'

subject: Error in docs for configuring dvr router
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-28 12:01:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/config-dvr-ha-snat.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e9615d13776be207f0aabe1fc54a96060062afc3', 'message': 'Error in docs for configuring dvr router

According to the docs on this link:

https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-dvr-ha-snat.html

"Configure the Open vSwitch agent. Add the following to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini:"

It should be openvswitch_agent.ini rather than ml2_conf.ini.

Change-Id: I138d1a52ea57b25bb403a6d1049e020c71c28e87
'}]
commit_message:
Error in docs for configuring dvr router

According to the docs on this link:

https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-dvr-ha-snat.html

"Configure the Open vSwitch agent. Add the following to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini:"

It should be openvswitch_agent.ini rather than ml2_conf.ini.

Change-Id: I138d1a52ea57b25bb403a6d1049e020c71c28e87

commit_message:
Add .stestr.conf .

Stestr after update changed configuration file format
This fix test warring : UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD. Please create one to to replace the .testr.conf. You can find a script to do this in the stestr.

Change-Id: I98fbaa31b63e324edf3a3fd79d0ce01c215055a9

commit_message:
Remove Keystone V2 acceptance tests

The Keystone V2 API has been fully removed (although, the auth.
API under V2 still exists).  The acceptance tests tries to make
requests to the V2 API which are failing (404).  This patch
removes the V2 tests.

Change-Id: I30d45e8e85d602dc9ff9eb50512e07d353f79e39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/59/505759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: shared_examples_for 'keystone user/tenant/service/role/endpoint resources using v2 API' do |auth_creds| it 'should find users in the default domain' do shell("openstack #{auth_creds} --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --os-identity-api-version 2 user list") do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/admin/) expect(r.stderr).to be_empty end end it 'should find tenants in the default domain' do shell("openstack #{auth_creds} --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --os-identity-api-version 2 project list") do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/openstack/) expect(r.stderr).to be_empty end end it 'should find beaker service' do shell("openstack #{auth_creds} --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --os-identity-api-version 2 service list") do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/beaker/) expect(r.stderr).to be_empty end end it 'should find admin role' do shell("openstack #{auth_creds} --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --os-identity-api-version 2 role list") do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/admin/) expect(r.stderr).to be_empty end end it 'should find beaker endpoints' do shell("openstack #{auth_creds} --os-auth-url http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 --os-identity-api-version 2 endpoint list --long") do |r| expect(r.stdout).to match(/1234/) expect(r.stderr).to be_empty end end end

commit_message:
Remove devstack-legacy base job

We added it to openstack-zuul-jobs so we can use it as a base job in
the migration.

Use the results of the migrated
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial to test that the base job
will work for migration purposes.

Depends-On: I3ff2b486702fed9342097cdcd30ffa0c043bdecc
Change-Id: I34514c2c38d2121c6b6fbca7e83bd273f2ec49f0

commit_message:
Remove dependency on Zun

The tempest tests have some dependencies on some modules on Zun
repo, but these modules are no longer available since tempest
plugin became a separated repo now.

Change-Id: Ic57ded871875c0481fdeedca19db2b61ab8d24c4

commit_message:
Next round of updates for legacy-install-afs-with-puppet

We need to quote "false" for SETUP_PIP, other wise yaml will convert
it to False.

Run puppet as root and clean up a puppet warning.

Change-Id: Ibb1d67bb8c95b99af7e9b5d1b28cd51cd9ba5089
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Fix upgrades that use Management network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-14 00:13:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3937605a80c1396f08595934403402399dbadd7c', 'message': 'Fix composable networks upgrades and remove extra IPv4 Redis VIP

This patch enables the management network even though it is not
enabled in any of the role definitions. This will allow upgrades
to complete using existing network environment files, without
requiring operators to switch to the new method for defining
which networks are attached to roles. This should allow for one
release where the deprecated methods work, before removing the
old environment templates and requiring the network_data.yaml
and roles to be modified to include non-default networks.

This patch also fixes an issue where the IPv4 environment files
were instantiating two Redis VIPs, only one of which was used
(the OS::TripleO::Network::RedisVipPort was used, but the
OS::TripleO::Controller::RedisVipPort was not used).

Change-Id: Iadd12a559f0ad6918958a1355f189187fd327363
Closes-bug: 1717123

commit_message:
Fix upgrades that use Management network

Upgrades from older versions using Management network fail.
This patch enables the management network even though it is not
enabled in any of the role definitions. This will allow upgrades
to complete using existing network environment files, without
requiring operators to switch to the new method for defining
which networks are attached to roles. Eventually these older
environment files will be removed.

Change-Id: Iadd12a559f0ad6918958a1355f189187fd327363
Closes-bug: 1717123

commit_message:
Fix more fixes for legacy-install-afs-with-puppet role

We actually want to use the copy task to make sure manifest.pp is
added on the remote node.

We also need to use SOURCE_MODULES otherwise install_modules.sh
doesn't work properly.

Set SETUP_PIP: false, as we already have pip installed into DIBs.

Change-Id: I5bb970a031121d80f73b1efb9dffc07dace67b73
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove dead versions code

The versions endpoint is now handled by Pecan
and there is no way to reach this old endpoint
now that we have dropped the web_framework option.

Change-Id: I5d493623b107f125cb9426310f2e43612c94bb7f

deleted_lines: import oslo_i18n import webob.dec from neutron._i18n import _ from neutron.api.views import versions as versions_viewfrom neutron import wsgi @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=wsgi.Request) def __call__(self, req): """Respond to a request for all Neutron API versions.""" version_objs = [ { "id": "v2.0", "status": "CURRENT", }, ] if req.path != '/': if self.app: return req.get_response(self.app) language = req.best_match_language() msg = _('Unknown API version specified') msg = oslo_i18n.translate(msg, language) return webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg) builder = versions_view.get_view_builder(req) versions = [builder.build(version) for version in version_objs] response = dict(versions=versions) metadata = {} content_type = req.best_match_content_type() body = (wsgi.Serializer(metadata=metadata). serialize(response, content_type)) response = webob.Response() response.content_type = content_type response.body = wsgi.encode_body(body) return response def __init__(self, app): self.app = app

commit_message:
Create stack home folder

The create stack user role creates the home for the stack user,
which works as long as the containing folder already exists.
Since this may not always be the case, create the folder first.

Change-Id: Ibe3539a738340d6e4d95e3661bca5e2067e3e959
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/17/506717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(andreaf) Create a user home_dir is not safe via # the user module since it will fail if the containing # folder does not exists. If the folder does exists and # it's empty, the skeleton is setup and ownership set. - name: Create the stack user home folder file: path: '{{ devstack_stack_home_dir }}' state: directory become: yes

commit_message:
Show resource's total count info in list APIs

This spec proposes adding total count info in
Cinder's list APIs.

Change-Id: Ic964df31120bc71a85c37f78d33cad8c51524ae2
Partial-Implements: bp add-amount-info-in-list-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/65/500665/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= Show resource's total count info in list APIs ============================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/add-amount-info-in-list-api This blueprint proposes adding total count info in Cinder's list APIs. Problem description =================== Show how many resources a user or tenant has is usually required in the web portal's summary section, but since we introduced the pagination mechanism, we only could get the ``{resource}_link`` which telling us you have more resources. In order to show this kind of total number to the end user, many clouds have to collect all of the resources while they only have to display the first page of the resource. Use Cases ========= The main use case is to have the administrators or users to know how many resources they have in total without retrieving and accumulating them all. Proposed change =============== Having the total count information in list API response is not only a requirement for Cinder or OpenStack, it's a common requirement for the REST APIs, so find out what are others doing may help us to have a better API model for this case. 1. Facebook API support the ``total_count`` attribute in their list APIs `[1]`_. And this is their API response:: { "data": [], "paging": {}, "summary": { "total_count": 100 } } 2. JSON API org adds an example to demonstrate the usage of ``total-pages`` or ``count`` in their recommended examples `[2]`_:: { "meta": { "total-pages": 10, "count": 100 }, "data": [], "links": { "self": "", "prev": "", "next": "" } } 3. StackExchange API also adds the total attribute in their ``Common Wrapper Object`` `[3]`_. And this is how their response looks like:: { "items": [], "page": 12, "page_size": 100, "total": 1200, } Since we have already added the ``{resources}_links`` attribute into our list API response. It makes more reasonable to have the amount info added into the response (take volume for example):: { "volumes_links": [], "volumes": [], "summary": { "total_count": 100 } } So, this bp proposes to add new attribute ``total_count`` in out list APIs ( including index and detail). We'd like to wrap it in the ``summary`` object because it easier for expansion, such as total_size etc. Based on our current pagination system `[4]`_, if we add the ``total_count`` attribute into our response body in default, the db's query statement would be executed twice for only one query which obviously has a performance impact, and not every request require this info. So additional query parameter is required to turn this on when listing resource:: /v3/{tenant_id}/{resource}?summary=total_count /v3/{tenant_id}/{resource}/detail?summary=total_count Note: the string value is preferred here in order to have end user choose which summary attribute he/she wants to display in the future. For the first step we only plan to add the summary support for our main resources: ``volumes``, ``snapshots`` and ``backups``. Alternatives ------------ There are few alternative solutions for this requirement, let's list and compare them all here. 1. Add amount information in response header:: X-resource-count: 200 The disadvantage of this is it will add some burden to the API customers, we don't have any history for adding useful content in response headers. Also it makes more difficult for documentation. 2. Add explicit API for each resources:: POST: /v3/{tenant_id}/{resources}/action {os-count} This change involves a lot of modifications and creates several new APIs. Adding this amount of APIs for such a simple API change is overdesign. 3. Create a new API for different resources:: POST: /V3/{tenant_id}/action {os-count} BODY: { "resource": "volume", "user": "user_1", "other_filter": "other_value" } For this change, one more API request is required if the end user wants to know how many resources in total when listing resources. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Microversion bump is required for this change. Cinder-client impact -------------------- All of the list commands will be upgraded to support this. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ There would be negative performance impact if the list API is requested with the summary option. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: tommylikehu(tommylikehu@gmail.com) Work Items ---------- * Add summary option support in list APIs * Add related unit testcases * Update cinder-client and OSC. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add unit tests to cover this change. Documentation Impact ==================== Update API documentation. References ========== _`[1]`: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/v2.1/user/friends _`[2]`: http://jsonapi.org/examples/ _`[3]`: https://api.stackexchange.com/docs/wrapper _`[4]`: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2324

commit_message:
Remove security_groups_provider_updated rpc code

In Pike, the agent side of security_groups_provider_updated()
RPC code was changed to a NOOP when the provider rules were
changed to be static, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/432506
Now that we're in Queens we can deprecate it.

Change-Id: Ie018ff653633d3524f0e80c5e172a5d01bdad437

commit_message:
Correct docs usage of keystoneauth1 session

keystoneclient.session has been long deprecated in favor of
keystoneauth1.session. This change corrects entries in the
documentation to use the correct library's session.

Change-Id: I08f8989e335e442787fa4c75497ee4be3a1ec35a

subject: Fix: retry journal.record on dependency deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-04 07:08:00.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/tests/unit/journal/test_journal.py', 'networking_odl/journal/journal.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/98b2281ece758a759d12675450907ab9855593d0', 'message': 'Fix: retry journal.record on dependency deleted

As it stands, between the moment that a dependency is calculated and the
new entry is recorded in the journal, an operation can ocurr that would
make the dependency irrelevant. If that is the case, the operation fails
with a `oslo_db.exception.DBReferenceError` that is not being caught by
`neutron.db.api.is_retriable` and thus ends with an error thrown to the
log and an unexpected result on the caller.

This was modified to catch that exception and then signal `is_retriable`
to retry the operation again, which would calculate the dependencies
again and try to insert again. This is done by raising a
`oslo_db.exception.RetryRequest` on a `DBReferenceError`.

Change-Id: I31c5fd9d903b3853e13c98c76b1f69c4676cad5e
Closes-Bug: #1713447
(cherry picked from commit 9214782e2516bac94a4478b2a11d3c88df3775d3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: retry journal.record on dependency deleted

As it stands, between the moment that a dependency is calculated and the
new entry is recorded in the journal, an operation can ocurr that would
make the dependency irrelevant. If that is the case, the operation fails
with a `oslo_db.exception.DBReferenceError` that is not being caught by
`neutron.db.api.is_retriable` and thus ends with an error thrown to the
log and an unexpected result on the caller.

This was modified to catch that exception and then signal `is_retriable`
to retry the operation again, which would calculate the dependencies
again and try to insert again. This is done by raising a
`oslo_db.exception.RetryRequest` on a `DBReferenceError`.

Change-Id: I31c5fd9d903b3853e13c98c76b1f69c4676cad5e
Closes-Bug: #1713447
(cherry picked from commit 9214782e2516bac94a4478b2a11d3c88df3775d3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/57/500457/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db import exception # NOTE(mpeterson): Between the moment that a dependency is calculated and # the new entry is recorded in the journal, an operation can ocurr that # would make the dependency irrelevant. In that case we request a retry. # For more details, read the commit message that introduced this comment. try: db.create_pending_row(plugin_context.session, object_type, object_uuid, operation, data, depending_on=depending_on) except exception.DBReferenceError as e: raise exception.RetryRequest(e)

commit_message:
Add --nodes configs used by rdophase2

RDO Phase 2 has been running with these 3 configs
for a very long time.  They allow for running on
64 GB virthosts, as well as our virt-ha configuration
which is 40 core, 192GB.

This commit moves these upstream where they should
live, vs. carrying internally.

Change-Id: I1651f723ea39602c015617d6f39743964a32e2b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/53/504153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Deploy an HA openstack environment. # # This will require (10 * 4) == approx. 40 GB for the overcloud # nodes, plus another 18GB for the undercloud, total 58 gb control_memory: 10240 compute_memory: 10240 undercloud_memory: 18432 # Giving the undercloud additional CPUs can greatly improve heat's # performance (and result in a shorter deploy time). # UC get's 4, and 2 for each OC node --> 12 total vcpu. # These machines are 12 core, might need to back down to 1 undercloud_vcpu: 4 default_vcpu: 2 # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: True node_count: 4 # Create three controller nodes and one compute node. overcloud_nodes: - name: control_0 flavor: control virtualbmc_port: 6230 - name: control_1 flavor: control virtualbmc_port: 6231 - name: control_2 flavor: control virtualbmc_port: 6232 - name: compute_0 flavor: compute virtualbmc_port: 6233 # Tell tripleo which nodes to deploy. topology: >- --compute-scale 1 --control-scale 3

commit_message:
Fix issue where 2 Redis VIPs are assigned, but only one used.

There is an extra RedisVipPort defined in network-isolation.j2.yaml
which is unused. This will waste an IP address, and can lead to
confusion if there are multiple ports named RedisVipPort.

This patch removes the extra (unneeded) instance of the VIP.

Change-Id: I222873859af1b4ed1050cfffe55687b2f8d4c528
Closes-bug: 1717017

commit_message:
Use ansible_user_dir for legacy-install-afs-with-puppet

Because we sudo to root, use full path for command task. Currently we
are getting file not found errors.

Change-Id: I9fb573a0e4abf03f9a8f5b20a55d2fea6ef60a72
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Create network-isolation-no-tunneling.yaml using jinja2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-20 22:32:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/013c91d94b3ad2dea3eee477ea51c706f12297d0', 'message': 'Create network-isolation-no-tunneling.yaml using jinja2

The existing network-isolation-no-tunneling.yaml contains
references to missing files. This patch generates the file
with jinja to include custom networks and make it work
with composable networks.

commit_message:
Create network-isolation-no-tunneling.yaml using jinja2

The existing network-isolation-no-tunneling.yaml contains
references to missing files. This patch generates the file
with jinja to include custom networks and make it work
with composable networks.

Closes-Bug: #1718797
Change-Id: Ibcab2f6b5ac880a6b3d7dd5126bd24facfa17322
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
Co-authored-by: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 47185342bdd247a2e2735ef96c777ecec663086d)

subject: Don't hardcode eth1 for undercloud nic config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-27 13:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['net-config-undercloud.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/2ffc62209bf14b7eb1c8191a8ef65e6b037c9604', 'message': 'Don't hardcode eth1 for undercloud nic config

eth1 will be the default as NeutronPublicInterface defaults to nic2,
which will be mapped to the second interface, which will be eth1 (all by
default).

So, there's no reason to hardcode to eth1 in the nic config template
directly, it can just use the special "interface_name" string which will
be replaced by the chosen nic at deployment time.

Change-Id: I97d1bb31cd8e24ed12ce916774aa83a6d11d410b
'}]
commit_message:
Don't hardcode eth1 for undercloud nic config

eth1 will be the default as NeutronPublicInterface defaults to nic2,
which will be mapped to the second interface, which will be eth1 (all by
default).

So, there's no reason to hardcode to eth1 in the nic config template
directly, it can just use the special "interface_name" string which will
be replaced by the chosen nic at deployment time.

Change-Id: I97d1bb31cd8e24ed12ce916774aa83a6d11d410b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/59/487859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-06 10:45:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/343973da0b81362146f16b18b76a5739be4cac6d', 'message': "Support for Ocata-Pike live-migration over ssh

To allow live migration during upgrade we need to temporarily pin the Pike

commit_message:
Support for Ocata-Pike live-migration over ssh

In Ocata all live-migration over ssh is performed on the default ssh port (22).
In Pike the containerized live-migration over ssh is on port 2022 as the
docker host's sshd is using port 22.

To allow live migration during upgrade we need to temporarily pin the Pike
computes to port 22 and in the final converge we can switch over to port 2022.

This also changes the default port to 2022 for baremetal computes in Pike to
enable live-migration between baremetal and containerized computes.

Change-Id: Icb9bfdd9a99dc1dce28eb95c50a9a36bffa621b1
Depends-On: I0b80b81711f683be539939e7d084365ff63546d3
Closes-Bug: 1714171

subject: Always use docker.io for ceph_namespace
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-22 09:40:18.000000000', 'files': ['container-images/overcloud_containers.yaml', 'container-images/overcloud_containers.yaml.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/9666d7c26ac63e07d96524704fa474a19f76211f', 'message': 'Always use docker.io for ceph_namespace

While the namespace variable does not carry the registry address,
which is defaulted to docker.io in tripleoclient, the ceph_namespace
variable needs one.

Also set the DockerCephDaemonImage value for CephClient and
CephExternal services which depend on CephBase.

Change-Id: I606158f11cb8d92876fdc4a01b7be482f471955b
Closes-Bug: #1717359
(cherry picked from commit 90e9ef9f4c51920564200b4a5063afc18bed4e10)
'}]
commit_message:
Always use docker.io for ceph_namespace

While the namespace variable does not carry the registry address,
which is defaulted to docker.io in tripleoclient, the ceph_namespace
variable needs one.

Also set the DockerCephDaemonImage value for CephClient and
CephExternal services which depend on CephBase.

Change-Id: I606158f11cb8d92876fdc4a01b7be482f471955b
Closes-Bug: #1717359
(cherry picked from commit 90e9ef9f4c51920564200b4a5063afc18bed4e10)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/80/506580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Disk targeting

This PS adds a disc targeting framework for OSH Components for
services like Ceph, Swift, and Cinder (LVM) to use when targeting
phsical discs. It uses the bus ID of the attached device to simplfy
management of large quanitites of physical hardware.

Change-Id: I1cb227e43ed5394d4c68c6156047889574a0e869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/74/496074/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ORIGINAL_DISCS=$(mktemp --suffix=.txt) sudo lshw -class disk > ${ORIGINAL_DISCS} ALL_DISCS=$(mktemp --suffix=.txt) sudo lshw -class disk > ${ALL_DISCS} NEW_DISCS=$(mktemp --suffix=.txt) diff --changed-group-format="%>" --unchanged-group-format="" ${ORIGINAL_DISCS} ${ALL_DISCS} > ${NEW_DISCS} cat ${NEW_DISCS} awk '/logical name:/ { print $NF }' ${NEW_DISCS} > ${LOOPBACK_LOGICAL_DISCS} awk '/bus info:/ { print $NF }' ${NEW_DISCS} > ${LOOPBACK_DISCS_BUS_ID}

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-20 19:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_opendaylight_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/add_odl_features_ml2_option-be14cd406e24febb.yaml', 'manifests/plugins/ml2/opendaylight.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/2417be6fae4df4003be0471a405d09a653d29f5d', 'message': 'Adds the ability to specify ML2 ODL Features

This is required in order to override the negotiated default features
with OpenDaylight.  More specifically this is required so that we can
override the features list not to include operational-port-status to
fix the following bug.

Partial-Bug: 1718508

Change-Id: I7eb752ad692e5522051f8393376890fcac9a09fe
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adds the ability to specify ML2 ODL Features

This is required in order to override the negotiated default features
with OpenDaylight.  More specifically this is required so that we can
override the features list not to include operational-port-status to
fix the following bug.

Partial-Bug: 1718508

Change-Id: I7eb752ad692e5522051f8393376890fcac9a09fe
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/81/505781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*odl_features*] # (optional) List of ODL features to enable # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $odl_features = $::os_service_default, 'ml2_odl/odl_features': value => join(any2array($odl_features), ',');

commit_message:
Replace the old auth_opts to the new in notifier/zaqar.py

change os_username to username, change os_passwd to passwd, change os_tenant_name to project_name, change os_auth_url to auth_url

Closes-Bug: #1699468

Change-Id: Ic81d30fc90673053bb2ce7a55a491c54bcc6776d

commit_message:
use variable fernet-key data bag

instead of hard coded vault name the attribute
['openstack']['secret']['secrets_data_bag'] is used.

Change-Id: I286fbfe89395544d1f8d0139acca0d689e4737fa
Closes-Bug: #1714523

commit_message:
rally: switch to new format for context name

Since I9d3bafa075631a3f48cbd3627a4cc1a5a859cce2 in rally, platform
should be part of context name (context@platform).

Otherwise, a warning message (or even breakage because of
I10ac687f9f420dcf0d907b51d5d9303f68d35719) may be triggered.

Change-Id: I6f84282d22d13d36dcba221ab9d94c3fda95f130

subject: The strategy to fix multi-node gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-22 20:39:55.000000000', 'files': ['zun_tempest_plugin/tests/tempest/api/test_containers.py', 'zun_tempest_plugin/tests/tempest/api/clients.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun-tempest-plugin/commit/ef0fe2f64678a577f1855dea43c71209ada49b22', 'message': 'The strategy to fix multi-node gate

In the tempest TestContainer, for e.x [1], we get the container with
model.uuid, then assert it with the desire state. The method
_get_container_state will use docker_client to get container. At that
time, the problem happens, docker client can get only container which
run in master node (the node run tempest), so sometimes it may return
None.

The new strategy is passing docker host get from model (model.hostname)
and pass to docker client. By this way, we can get container in the
specific host.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/tests/tempest/api/test_containers.py#L408

Change-Id: I6604889d9fc49a4a828eaf0c4014881791bfd3c7
Implements: blueprint multi-node-ci
'}]
commit_message:
The strategy to fix multi-node gate

In the tempest TestContainer, for e.x [1], we get the container with
model.uuid, then assert it with the desire state. The method
_get_container_state will use docker_client to get container. At that
time, the problem happens, docker client can get only container which
run in master node (the node run tempest), so sometimes it may return
None.

The new strategy is passing docker host get from model (model.hostname)
and pass to docker client. By this way, we can get container in the
specific host.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/tests/tempest/api/test_containers.py#L408

Change-Id: I6604889d9fc49a4a828eaf0c4014881791bfd3c7
Implements: blueprint multi-node-ci

commit_message:
Add latest or branch info to success url

After we do the prep, the docs are in the latest dir. Make sure it's
on the success-url.

On stable branches they are in directories named after their branch. Add
variants for those.

Change-Id: I2c18214508bdb1962541d52f3634f77e19a1bd0b

commit_message:
Allow fullstack to operate on dhclient-script for OpenSUSE

This script's permissions by default limits access to root, but
that is not consistent to other platforms. Tweaking the permissions
is the easiest/least impactful fix imaginable.

Change-Id: Icfad974cb0c9f896b05003ea0f89693528eaeb80

commit_message:
Tweak configure_for_func_testing to work on OpenSUSE

Ensure OpenSUSE is supported as a platform when installing
packages. Signal also that the configuration is completed
successfully. That's friendly when the script is invoked
manually.

Change-Id: Id9489ecbbacaf7b98a022e7fbdd9cddae3a4c398

commit_message:
Add tests to validate instance_list handles faults correctly

Change-Id: I24ba3f175641409e0a56ae6357ba4859144a0bef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/505392/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if i % 2 == 0: # Make some faults for this instance for n in range(0, i + 1): msg = 'fault%i-%s' % (n, inst.hostname) f = objects.InstanceFault(context=cctx, instance_uuid=inst.uuid, code=i, message=msg, details='fake', host='fakehost') f.create() def test_get_sorted_with_faults(self): """Make sure we get faults when we ask for them.""" insts = list( instance_list.get_instances_sorted(self.context, {}, None, None, ['fault'], ['hostname'], ['asc'])) # Two of the instances in each cell have faults (0th and 2nd) expected_faults = self.NUMBER_OF_CELLS * 2 expected_no_fault = len(self.instances) - expected_faults faults = [inst['fault'] for inst in insts] self.assertEqual(expected_no_fault, faults.count(None)) def test_get_sorted_paginated_with_faults(self): """Get pages of one with faults. Do this specifically so we make sure we land on faulted marker instances to ensure we don't omit theirs. """ insts = [] while True: if insts: marker = insts[-1]['uuid'] else: marker = None batch = list( instance_list.get_instances_sorted(self.context, {}, 1, marker, ['fault'], ['hostname'], ['asc'])) if not batch: break insts.extend(batch) self.assertEqual(len(self.instances), len(insts)) # Two of the instances in each cell have faults (0th and 2nd) expected_faults = self.NUMBER_OF_CELLS * 2 expected_no_fault = len(self.instances) - expected_faults faults = [inst['fault'] for inst in insts] self.assertEqual(expected_no_fault, faults.count(None))

subject: Set Ceph pgp_num after pg_num
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-22 09:41:50.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a3bb7a5b4e6964e156a6c141cfb8e9cd115a5cef', 'message': 'Set Ceph pgp_num after pg_num

We missed to set the pgp_num default in ceph.conf, causing WARNING
messages like:

  pool default.rgw.buckets.data pg_num 32 > pgp_num 8

Also increases the default pg_num to 128 which is the recommended
value for less than 5 OSDs [1].

1. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/operations/placement-groups/

Change-Id: Ibd9fb23e04576e95e24af58f856663397886a947
Closes-Bug: #1718173
(cherry picked from commit 58e6f6533a04eddd2dc897d890737bbccde4ea7b)
'}]
commit_message:
Set Ceph pgp_num after pg_num

We missed to set the pgp_num default in ceph.conf, causing WARNING
messages like:

  pool default.rgw.buckets.data pg_num 32 > pgp_num 8

Also increases the default pg_num to 128 which is the recommended
value for less than 5 OSDs [1].

1. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/operations/placement-groups/

Change-Id: Ibd9fb23e04576e95e24af58f856663397886a947
Closes-Bug: #1718173
(cherry picked from commit 58e6f6533a04eddd2dc897d890737bbccde4ea7b)

commit_message:
Add ODL repo to override template

tripleo_kolla_override_template.j2 disables all external
repo. ODL is not present in Delorean repo and hence
ODL image build fails. This patch enables ODL repo in
the override template needed to built the image.

Change-Id: I27a49fa32420cb5f44ad516c5d65949a8f62cf29
Closes-Bug: #1716604
(cherry picked from commit 7c3bbdffacd5aff9ab5d72ac07847198388cd711)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/04/506604/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# Enable ODL repo in ODL Dockerfile {% block opendaylight_header %} RUN echo $'[opendaylight-6-release]
\ name=CentOS CBS OpenDaylight Carbon repository
\ baseurl=http://cbs.centos.org/repos/nfv7-opendaylight-6-release/$basearch/os/
\ enabled=1
\ gpgcheck=0' >> /etc/yum.repos.d/opendaylight.repo {% endblock %}
